alert.note: Alert for Logan County; Morgan County; Northeast Weld County; Phillips County; Sedgwick County; Washington County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 22 at 2:36AM MST until December 22 at 9:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: .A very cold airmass is in place over northeastern Colorado, and breezy winds will continue to cause dangerous wind chill. Snowfall is diminishing and should end by sunrise, but drifting and blowing snow and snow covered, slick roads will impact the morning commute. ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST FRIDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM MST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Snowfall diminishing, additional accumulations up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. Dangerously cold wind chills as low as 55 below zero. * WHERE...The far northeast plains of Colorado, including northeast Weld, Morgan, Washington, Logan, Phillips and Sedgwick Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 11 AM MST Friday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 9 AM MST this morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.
info.instruction: The combination of wind and cold temperatures will create dangerously low wind chill values. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.

area.areaDesc: Logan County; Morgan County; Northeast Weld County; Phillips County; Sedgwick County; Washington County
